intro: Dombeya boivinii, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Dombeya boivinii thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
